meanings.definition: The quality of being able to articulate or express oneself clearly.
meanings.sent1: Her articulacies in the presentation impressed the audience.
meanings.sent2: The professor's articulacies made the complex topic easy to understand.
meanings.sent3: His articulacies were so good that he could explain quantum physics to a child.
meanings.sent4: The articulacies of her storytelling painted vivid pictures in the listeners' minds.
meanings.sent5: The politician's articulacies won over even the toughest critics.

meanings.definition: The distinctiveness or clarity of speech sounds.
meanings.sent1: The singer's articulacies were evident in every note she sang.
meanings.sent2: The articulacies of the language made it challenging for beginners to pronounce.
meanings.sent3: The parrot's articulacies mimicking human speech always amused the guests.
meanings.sent4: The articulacies of the wind whispering through the trees created a calming effect.
meanings.sent5: The actor's articulacies in enunciating each word captivated the audience.
